intro: Crocus ilgazensis, commonly known as the Ilgaz crocus, is a rare and endemic species native to the Ilgaz Mountains in Turkey. This plant belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often purple or lilac-colored flowers. It typically blooms in early spring, showcasing its ornamental value in alpine environments. The plant prefers well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
